person.name: Camille
dialogue: Hmm... I'm always confused in this class...
If you want to ask a question in French, you can say J'ai une question. That means I have a question.
French often uses apostrophes to shorten words when a vowel comes next.

In this example, <<J'ai>> is really Je + ai. 
<<Je>> means 'I', and <<ai>> means 'have'
French loves smooth sound flow, so we remove the vowel in Je and add an apostrophe.
<<Je ne comprends pas>> â€” means 'I don't understand' in French
Here, ne and pas are used to make a sentence negative.

To negate a verb in French, we put ne before the verb and pas after it. So 'I don't understand' becomes <<Je ne [comprends] pas>> 
and you can replace [comprends] with any verb! Like this: 
<<Je ne [verb] pas>> to negate any meaning.
